level.heading: Sale or distribution of beverages by minor prohibited.

level.text: Except as provided in subsection (b) of this section, a licensee shall not allow any person under 21 years of age to sell, give, furnish, or distribute an alcoholic beverage.

A licensee may allow an employee who is 18 years of age or older to sell, serve, or deliver an alcoholic beverage on the licensed premises; provided, that no employee under 21 years of age shall serve as a bartender.

level.heading: HISTORICAL AND STATUTORY NOTES
level.text: D.C. Law 13-298 amended and enacted into law Title 25 of the District of Columbia Official Code. The text of this section is derived from provisions formerly found in D.C. Code §§ 25-121(j) and 25-125. For notes from former § 25-121, see § 25-781.

level.heading: Legislative History of Laws
level.text: For D.C. Law 13-298, see notes following § 25-101.
For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-178, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 25-781.
For legislative history of D.C. Law 6-217, see Historical and Statutory Notes following § 25-101.
